commit message: Update tools
Close the socket in case we actually connect
Add drawer icons
Add a left drawer that will be used to access more features and possibly setting of the application
Remove old stlye of drawer icon
Add new material style drawer icon (also support more densities)
Use the new material icon
Add ID to the icon
Start filling the left drawer by adding an item to launch a new activity for scanning external hosts
Change host discovery text to indicate that it's for the LAN
Use real ellipses

Cleaner XML
Some cleanup
Open the left drawer when the user clicks on the icon
Rename HostActivity to LanHostActivity
Remove TAG constants
Sort the open ports that are added to the list by explicity grabbing the numeric value and comparing them
Some cleanup and modularization
More cleanup and modularization
Small var name change
No need for SO_REUSEADDR since we're not binding
Break out some strings into the resource file
Add new strings

Implement NetBIOS resolution in addition to DNS. Bring in the JCIFS lib, switch to using a synchronized list to avoid race conditions, change interface to accept a generic List instead of an explicit ArrayList, and make sure we update the UI from the UI thread explicitly when all the other threads are adding discovered hosts to the list

Set the number of threads to use for all operations in the ScanHostsAsyncTask and change the cached thread pool to a fixed thread pool. Catch the case where the netios entry replacement wouldn't work because of other threads updating the list at the same time causing the index that is used to check whether a replacemet is needed or not to change. Instead, look for the exact object in the list and grab the index
Docs
No need to get the hostname twice since it's passed in by the main activity
Sort the host list based on the last octet of the IP on the second line
Don't sort the open ports on the UI thread
Also probe for more info abou the server on port 8080
Just because the methods are synchronized on the synchronized list doesn't mean that it's 100% thread safe just like that. Move back to an array list and synchronize the areas that need it
Bump up the threads and increase the socket timeout
Dont show toast
Increase socket timeout slightly when scanning ports
Don't leak database resources
Get scanned port right before its needed
Don't sort on the UI thread
Check on the scan progress dialog inside of the UI thread to avoid race conditions and rare crashes that happen due to inconsistencies in the data from one thread to another
Code analysis badge and better formatting of the README
Avoid NullPointerExceptions
Better way of checking empty string
Send the host name and IP separately
Add a nice unicode symbol for ports 80, 443, and 8080 and open them to a browser when the user clicks on the item in the list
Avoid the overhead of double brace initialization since it creates a new anonymous class derived from my class
Sort right after we add the newest open port to the list, otherwise the last item will not be considered in the sorting routine
